titleStmt.title: William Munday et al. to Unknown
CWG9290

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned citizens of Clark County Kentucky, would respectfully represent to your Excellency, that at the May Term 1860 of the Circuit Court of said County Mssrs Wm L White and James White confessed Judgments each for $2000 and costs upon indictments for Gaming, in which Game they participated about 3 years since wherever they played for 5 cents for one single game for amusement That they are young men of high character, and their conduct ever since the said game was played, has been moral and orderly, We respectfully desire that your Excellency may remit so much of the fine as in your power We will venture to assure you that they will never offend the Laws again.

William Munday
James Munday
O P Evans
A N Bush
Thos Gaines
Geo M Jackson
S. W. Brock
David Brown
W. W. Stone
S H Cochran
John P Hukill
